reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights returning 19th Dec 2006
reviews.title: would not reccomend for a honeymoon

likes.liked: — the bar with the open fire
likes.disliked: — the distance from the main facilities to our room

reviews.text: The hotel was okay not worn or shabby which we had read on trip advisor. The food was fine edible the gala dinner was a bit naff the ranger didnt seem to have much idea on how to entertain us. We was supposed to get a certificate to say that we had been to the artic circle ceremony but the rangers didnt give us one.The holiday company are supposed to be posting ours to us
reviews.title: a typical european ski hotel

likes.liked: — it did what it said it would

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The activities day was long and quite exhausting the suit that was provided was very good and absolutely essential
reviews.title: Great food and spa, basic accommodation
Holiday Club a bit worn
reviews.text: We did feel a bit left out as we hadnt got any young children with us. Our daughter is 15yrs old but we still wanted to go and see santa and do all the rides but we felt that we got ignored a bit because we hadnt got any young children in our party.I would thoroughly reccomend going on this holiday as a once in a live time experience Santa was so real he was marvelous.It waw quite expensive to have drinks in the hotel so we didnt have many. The flights was delayed both ways but no one seemed to complain. overall a good experience
We have just returned from a two night santa trip staying at this hotel. It appears to be the largest hotel in this tiny resort of saariselka which is approx 20-30 mins from Ivalo airport.
reviews.title: Not a four star hotel - more like a 2 with a great pool

reviews.text: We booked last minute to do the Santa Spectacular trip with Esprit staying at the Holiday Club, Saariselka. Visiting the real Father Christmas in Lapland had always been a bit of a dream for me so the experience had a lot to live up to.
reviews.title: Great base for a magical experience in Saariselka

reviews.text: From the moment that we arrived at Ivalo aiport the trip was well organised. With a short stop to pick up our thermals - we were at the hotel within an hour or so of landing. The hotel doesn't look that large from the outside but as we discovered over the next couple of days, it's a bit of a tardis. I would describe the hotel as functional rather than attractive but it's none the worse for that. We had a room on the second floor which was a bit of a pain when lugging all our bags up there as there was no lift. The room itself was basic but comfortable. With 4 of us travelling the kids had to sleep on the pull out sofa which didn't leave a lot of room over for moving around. This hardly mattered though as we spent so little time in our room.
reviews.title: Hotel club Saariselka, great base for your lapland adventure

likes.liked: — Great pool 4 kids and attutude of reception to kids

reviews.text: The main attraction of this hotel, apart from its location, has to be the pool which was fantastic, particularly all lit up in the dark. The kids spent hours playing on the water slide and enjoying the wave machine which came on for a few minutes on the hour. it was great to laze in the pool looking out at the snow covered trees.
reviews.title: Saw the Northern Lights!

likes.liked: — Wood burner, sauna and pool - and warmth!
likes.disliked: — Distance to transport young children in the snow before we could eat breakfast

reviews.text: The food at the hotel was again basic but plentiful, we certainly didn't go hungry. Breakfast was a buffet - the kids particularly enjoyed the waffle machine (although perhaps it would have been a good idea for the hotel to provide more than one of these!) Dinner was a buffet on each evening. It certainly couldn't be described as gourmet and I did hear some complaints but we were quite happy with everything. Drinks were expensive so you didn't see too many people rolling around drunk!
reviews.title: A good choice of hotel!

likes.liked: — The pool, the friendliness of the staff, food
likes.disliked: — no veggie option at dinner, our room too far from reception

reviews.title: Don't book the Gala Dinner
reviews.text: Saariselka itself was lovely, very quiet and peaceful. We spent each evening after dinner on the toboggan slope which we all loved. On christmas night we walked up to the top of the 1.2 km run (in the vain hope of seeing the northern lights) and tobogganed down by the light of the full moon - absolutely magical.

My judgement may be a little a foggy on ths one as its some, time ago now since we made the trip. It was Dec 2005 myself husband and then 4.5 yo daughter. The trip was with Esprit who were very efficient. The hotel was fine warm clean food was adequate swimming pool was great, it certainly wasnt luxury but it was fine. Saarisellka was lovely remote and a winter wonderland as we expected. Only downside we didnt see the Northern lights, oh well we willhave to go again one day !
reviews.title: fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike many of the reviewers here, the two of us were not based here for a holiday. We only stayed one night before heading North for a three day snowmobile safari up to the Baring Sea.
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: The reception was friendly and efficient and we were upgraded to a suite. This looked like it had last been decorated by Mrs Brezhnev in about 1980 but was nonetheless comfortable and spacious, with its own private sauna. The sheets were amazing - the sort of polycotton I remember from my childhood where you can create excellent static electricity displays!
reviews.title: Absolutely Magical ! Santa Spectacular with Esprit via Santatrips.co.uk

reviews.text: The centre of the hotel has a huge pool with a water slide and various other fun-looking things but we didn't get a chance to use that.
reviews.title: Holiday Club, the good and not so good!
It is only what you make of it
reviews.text: Breakfast was a good buffet but that was the only meal we ate since we had arrived late (aeroplane troubles) and had to leave early in the morning.
We had a wonderful 3 day holiday in Lapland staying at this hotel. We booked through Esprit who I have to recommend whole heartedly. However, the hotel was not perfect.
reviews.title: Visiting Santa with Esprit was great but the hotel could have been better
picturesque and amazing
reviews.text: We paid extra to stay in a small apartment. The 2 kids (2 and 4 years) stayed in the bedroom and we stayed on a permenant put up bed in a corner of the lounge. Unfortunately, the beds springs could be felt when you laid on it in the lounge although the kids beds were fine.

Also, 2 of the large windows in the apartment did not have blackout blinds which were required as there were strong outside lights which shone through both and could not be turned off. This effected the quality of our sleep.
reviews.title: Wonderful
After A Rocky Start .......
reviews.text: The hotel has a wonderful pool with wave machine, a slide, a lazy river and childrens pool, plus jacuzzis.

Please make sure that you take plenty of batteries for your camera and keep them warm. On your activity day keep one in your camera and the other close to your body to keep it warm. Swap them regularly.
reviews.title: Fantastic trip to Saariselka

likes.disliked: — The pool area was too cold
